name: 1 - Inspection and Test Plan Reviewed and Approved by Customer
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Inspection and Test plan shall be submitted to the Engineer for review and approval before fabrication is commenced.
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Shop Drawing shall be submitted to Engineer for review along with Shop Drawing Check form
Certify Doc / Ref - Shop Drawing Check form

Acceptance Criteria - Details of the welding procedures to be used including details of the equipment and consumables before any welding is carried out. No welder shall carry out work for which he is not certified.
Certify Doc / Ref - Welding Procedures, HERA/CSWIP Stamp
Acceptance Criteria - A list of proposed welders and their welding certificatesto be provided prior to any welding being carried out.
○ No welder shall carry out work for which he is not certified.
Certify Doc / Ref - WQT by Authorised Person (Welding Supervisor)
5 - Procurement of materials in line with IFC drawings and Technical Specification
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Materials match that specified in Project IFC drawings and Technical Specification.
○ Structural steel Material shall be sourced from suppliers certified by ACRS
○ Material test certificates shall report all element required by AS/NZS relevant standard, plus total boron content (Manufacturer certificates shall from ILAC MRA laboratories)
Certify Doc / Ref - Supplier Material Certificate
6 - Procurement of Welding consumable to match Weld procedure and parent materials.
Acceptance Criteria - Welding consumables and gas match what is specified on the appropriate welding procedures.
Certify Doc / Ref - Supplier Material Certificate, PFS Welding Procedures
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - All material shall be inspected against IFC drawing to make sure material grades, type, thickness, size are in compliance with IFC DWGs.
8 - Manufacturing Work Pack Issued to Production Manager
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Job barcodes, Inspection & Test Plan's, IFC Fabrication Drawings, Reference Drawings/Info, Welding Procedures, weld map, welding log info, traceability sheet
9 - Identification and traceability for main items
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG, AS/NZS 5131

Acceptance Criteria - Lot traceability shall be provided for main structural members, connections between main structural members and major plate components. Tracibility as per AS/NZS 5131:Amd 1:2020 5.2.3 (ii) for minor components including cleats, connecting brackets and the like.
10 - Manufacture of steel structure - Tack welded only
Acceptance Criteria - Manufacture completed as per IFC Fabrication drawings.
○ All tack welding shall be performed in accordance with PFS weld procedure.
○ Welding consumables, process & any applicable pre/post heat requirements shall comply with approved welding procedure's.
Acceptance Criteria - Dimensional survey of fabricated item's against IFC drawings.
○ Measured dimensions shall be within stated tolerances unless noted otherwise.
○ Functional Tolerances shall be class 2 as per AS/NZS 5131 Table F2.1 to F2.10
○ Inspections recorded in line with SHEQ-01-02-0035 Product Inspection Procedure
Acceptance Criteria - All welding shall be performed in accordance with PFS weld procedures

○ Welding consumables, process & any applicable pre/post heat requirements shall comply with approved welding procedure's. Welder ID, weld date & consumable batch are recorded on traceability register.
Certify Doc / Ref - Welding Procedure and Welder Qualification
Acceptance Criteria - Dimensional survey of fabricated item's against IFC drawings.
○ Measured dimensions shall be within stated tolerances unless noted otherwise.
○ Functional Tolerances shall be class 2 as per AS/NZS 5131 Table F2.1 to F2.10
○ Inspections recorded in line with SHEQ-01-02-0035 Product Inspection Procedure
Certify Doc / Ref - IFC DWGs & Workshop Pack.
Acceptance Criteria - 100% of all welds shall be subject to visual scanning
Certify Doc / Ref - PFS NDT Register
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01
Acceptance Criteria - NDE shall include as a minimum:
○ The Welding Compliance Inspector shall complete all inspections including any additional inspection, tests and reports necessary due to any welding or welding related workmanship defects.
Certify Doc / Ref - Stamped NDT report
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01
Acceptance Criteria - Removal of all weld spatter and dressing of any weld to removed sharp edges / spatter.
○ All sharp edges are ground to a smooth 2 mm radius.
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01
Acceptance Criteria - All Non-conformities reported in PFS NCR system during manufacturing of steel structure need to be submitted to Client for approval
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - After coating, the bracketes to be assembled on GRP material
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG, SHEQ-01-02-0040
Acceptance Criteria - Manual holing shall be performed on GRP material.
Acceptance Criteria - Compliance with IFC DWGs
Acceptance Criteria - All fasteners (bolts, nuts, washers) are to be in complied with the Project requirement (Grade, Size and Length)
22 - Snug tightening of fastener to fasten the brackets to the GRP material
Specification Standard - Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening, SHEQ-01-02-0038
Acceptance Criteria - 100% of fixings securing brackets to be inspected for snug tight condition and marked with coloured paint pen to confirm fixing condtion has been checked and verified.
23 - Assembly of the angles between brackets
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - The angles to be assembled between bracket with fasteners
24 - Snug tightening of fastener to fasten angles to the brackets
Specification Standard - Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening, SHEQ-01-02-0038

Acceptance Criteria - 100% of fixings securing brackets and angles to be inspected for snug tight condition and marked with coloured paint pen to confirm fixing condtion has been checked and verified.
Specification Standard - IFC Drawings, AS/NZS 1554.1:2014 Category SP

Acceptance Criteria - Visual and Dimensional inspections completed by PFS Project Manager to confirm manufactured items have been manufactured to acceptable standard & tolerance and approved to progress to protective coatings.
○ >Confirmation that dimensional inspections have been completed in line with SHEQ-01-02-0035 Product Inspection Procedure
○ >Confirmation that required quantity and type's of NDE has been completed and any identified defects have been remediated.
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Documentation, Certificates and reports to support manufacture of steel structure and subcontracted items compiled into PFS Manufactures Data Report
Certify Doc / Ref - PFS Manufactures Data Report
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.

name: 1 - Inspection and Test Plan Reviewed and Approved by Customer
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Inspection and Test plan shall be submitted to the Engineer for review and approval before fabrication is commenced.
2 - Submit the required documents to Client for review
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01
Acceptance Criteria - Site installation methodology shall be submitted to the Engineer for review
Certify Doc / Ref - Erection Sequence Methodology
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm Procurement and delivery of all Cast in Items:
ii. uplift restraints and associated nuts
iv. Maccaloy bars (ETA 06/01/25) and couplers with denso tape.
v. Reidbar and couplers + touch up protective coating.
vi. Nylon washers and rubber sleeves.
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - The material receipt at site need to be visually inspected for quantity and make sure no damage occurred during transport
5 - Inspection upon receipt at site - Cast in Items.
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - The material receipt at site need to be visually inspected for quantity, make sure no damage occurred during transport. All related documents have been received.
6 - Preparation work - prior to Span Lifting for All Spans
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Make sure survey has been done and center marks on the framework as a reference have been provided by Downer
○ Installation of 100x100 EA as a lifting aid on temporary structure
○ Span unloaded from truck and placed on Dunnage on ground prior to rigging adjustment
○ Attaching the tag lines to Spans to prevent rotation during installation
7 - Confirm all Manufacture documentation has been completed for Span #2
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01
Acceptance Criteria - Confirming that the fabrication, coating, and factory erection (including balustrade and deck panel bolting) works have been signed off.
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Verify that the structural component is securely rigged according to the rigging plan
○ To lift Span #2 and Position the component precisely over the pile and lower it slowly into its final placement on temporary girder support structure
○ Chain block will be connected to the West end to adjust level.
○ When location is confirmed by surveyor and PFS staff, span to be secured in place to the slim soldiers.
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG

Acceptance Criteria - To keep Macalloy bar aligned, a coupler to be tightened to extend the Macalloy bar and Tempory nut will be added to the rod on the Span 2 high end. The nuts will be tightened to hold the Macalloy bars in correct position.

Acceptance Criteria - Confirming that the fabrication, coating, and factory erection (including balustrade and deck panel bolting) works have been signed off.

Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Conduct a thorough dimensinal survay inspection to confirm that the component is correctly positioned and secured based on IFC Drawing.
○ Measured dimensions shall be within stated tolerances unless noted otherwise.
○ Functional Tolerances shall be class 2 as per AS/NZS 5131 Table F2.1 to F2.10
○ Record the lifting operation in the project log, including any deviations or required adjustments to be made.
Certify Doc / Ref - Marked up and Signed IFC DWGs
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Lossen Reidbars to match IFC drawing detail at all peirs before any headstock pours.
24 - Reid bar touch up painting (if required)
Acceptance Criteria - Any coatings damage to Reidbars touched up as per paint specification, Coatings to comply with note 1.2 on drawing ST-3202.
Certify Doc / Ref - Project Paint Specification
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, IFC Drawings, Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening, SHEQ-01-02-0038

Acceptance Criteria - Remove additional nuts, tape (masking and double sided) used for alignment. Apply rubber sleeves to the exposed threads. Reinstall oversized washers, apply instulating washers and tighten nuts down to achive a 1mm gap between washer and nut, lock nut to be installed as per detail C & Section 5 on ST-3202, Detail D on ST-3200.
Certify Doc / Ref - Bolt Tightening report
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, IFC Drawings, Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening, SHEQ-01-02-0038

Acceptance Criteria - to Undo the coupler, remove temporary alignment nut, install the rubber sleeves to the exposed rod, install the washers, nuts and snug tighten the nuts (as there are compressible components in contanc area)
Certify Doc / Ref - Bolt Tightening report
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - All temporary restraints to the temporary shoring to be removed
○ All positioning Jigs and screws applied to PTFE on Shear Keys to be removed
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, IFC Drawings, Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening, SHEQ-01-02-0038
Acceptance Criteria - The Temporary Bearing to be removed and Granor Bearing to be installed in the position
○ The Bolts need to be snug tightened to the girders (top) and screws need to be snug tightened into the base plate.
○ The keeper plates' bolts (M20) for uplift restraint to be tightened (full Tensioned).
Certify Doc / Ref - Bolt Tightening report
29 - Installation of remaining Decking panels and wall panels
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Carefully position the Decking and wall panels in the conjunction area according to the approved drawings.
30 - Snug tightening of Decking panels and wall panels
Specification Standard - Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening, SHEQ-01-02-0038
Acceptance Criteria - Fasteners of Decking and wall panels to be inspected for snug tight condition and marked with coloured paint pen to confirm fixing condtion has been checked and verified.
Certify Doc / Ref - Bolt Tightening report
31 - Installation of remaining handrails between the spans
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Carefully position the handrails in the conjunction area according to the approved drawings.
Specification Standard - Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening, SHEQ-01-02-0038

Acceptance Criteria - Fasteners of handrails to be inspected for snug tight condition with addition of Loctite or Locknut to prevent loosening and marked with coloured paint pen to confirm fixing condtion has been checked and verified.
○ Note: The connections for the EA's spanning the pier movement joints shall be hand tightened, Ref CAN 063.
Certify Doc / Ref - Bolt Tightening report
Specification Standard - Site installation methodology, IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - The expansion plates to be installed between Span 1 and 2 and between span 6 and 7
34 - Inspection to identify any damage to painted surfaceses requiring touchup

Acceptance Criteria - Inspect paint for any required repair and touch up of paint works (bolted connections and any damage paint to steelwork). Repair method proposed shall be approved by the independent coating inspector. Areas repaired shall be reinspected by the coating applicator and independent inspector.
Certify Doc / Ref - Note 1.2, Drawing ST-3202
Specification Standard - Erection sequence methodology (EMS), IFC Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Visual and Dimensional inspections completed by PFS Project Manager to confirm manufactured items have been completely installed.
○ Inspection of erected steelwork in accordance with AS/NZS 5131 Section 13.11 as per specification C0702.1.10.
○ Inspections shall cover all relevant items listed in clause 13.11.1.
○ Inspections shall be documented in inspection reports as per clause 13.11.3 of AS/NZS5131, and included in the QA documentation.

○ Inspections shall be conducted by competent personnel. Evidence of experience or qualifications for nominated individual(s) shall be provided for review. An example of qualification of competent personnel is a relevant trade qualification and over 10 years experience in structural steel erection.
○ Following inspection on site, should any modification or repairs be required a written procedure shall be submitted to the Engineer prior to any work proceeding as per C0702.3.
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01, IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Documentation and reports to support installation of steel structure items compiled into PFS Manufactures Data Report
Certify Doc / Ref - PFS Manufactures Data Report
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
